reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Improvement from the 1st generation
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2024
reviews.comment: Definitely an improvement from the 1st generation indoor camera series.Better image quality and sound.The only thing I don’t like is that you can only use it in the Google Home app and not the Nest app (which is advertised and I was aware of). Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeping this camera
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025
reviews.comment: Just a heads up you only get 'event' view for free with nest cameras, but for $8 that changes across all nest cameras. This camera is extremely easy to set up, Google Home is a wonderful app that hasn't caused any issues for us, the design is nice and build quality feels solid. Connection to the camera is the best we've experienced (many cameras use 2.4ghz for streaming), which is awful. This has run at 99.9% consistentcy and even with that missing percent it was due to the phone not connecting, not the camera itself shutting off. We returned two Chinese cameras and got this camera, which was significantly more expensive but worth the investment. Night vision is excellent and there are plenty of other features within the app. Oh, and the AI it uses is incredible, you can record in your home and have it only recognize a pet or individual person instead of it notifying you of everything it sees. Talking through it also works perfectly. Little to no delay on streaming. 5 stars. Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Almost best in its class.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2025
reviews.comment: One of the best to use, setup, find the quality picture and video view. Just install anywhere close to electric outlet and setup in your google account. It has very good range to see the Wi-Fi and connected easily. A little bit price but overall is very good. Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2025
reviews.comment: I got this to add to my home security. This is my 4 Google cam in my setup. This is the indoor camera and I placed it in my bedroom window facing my driveway. Since I have the top rier recording subscription it records 24/7. It was easy to set up and add to my Google home. NOTE: if you want this against your window and there is a lot of lightning outside play with the night vision option. When I turned nigth vision off the image improved dramatically. With it on it was way to bright and you couls not see much. Great buy with good 1080 resolution. Read more

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars As good as any Nest cam, does not work well with Alexa
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.comment: I used to have a Dropcam Pro back when Nest bought Dropcam. Then, of course, Google ended up buying Nest later. I had moved to Eufy, and Eufy had some disastrous privacy issues leading me to switch back to what I know the best, Nest..err, Google.I got it hoping it would work well with Alexa (Amazon Echo Dot) to notify me of person alerts, etc, as Google had finally created an Alexa Skill. Unfortunately, that was not the case. The Alexa skill is limited, and can only send out alerts if unrecognized motion is detected. If the camera detects a person, even if not a familiar face, it will not notify Amazon/Alexa. This was not at all what I expected. The only way around this would be to turn off person detection and use motion detection, but that would be a considerable downgrade, and I paid a lot for this camera to get what it offers.I won't be the first to say this, but if you are used to the Nest app, do not expect the same experience using the Google Home app. Google Home app is much worse, even on Android. I'm not too fond of it, and they need to do more updates and overall UI changes for it to be usable. Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well for our needs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
reviews.comment: We wanted another outside camera but we did not have any electrical outlets in the area. So, we bought this and placed it inside the window pointed outside and it is adding the security we wanted. A couple of things to know. You will not get the outside sound using it this way so we muted the sound. It worked great during the day but when it got dark and the camera mode switched to night vision we could only see the camera reflection. We disable the night vision and it works great and we have more than enough light outside to see everything. Read more

reviews.title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Extremely Disappointing, Expected more from Google
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2022
reviews.comment: I've been using Amazon Cloudcam since it's inception, unfortunately Amazon has discontinued that service. I was quite happy with it, cameras had good video quality (all things considered when they first came out), performance was good, desktop viewing, easy to load recorded clips.Being forced to get a new camera was daunting, I did as much research as possible and chose the Google Nest cam. Yearly subscription and features seemed good, cameras were reasonably priced compared to Ring and came with the Google Home ecosystem which was promising.Got my cameras, installed them and then all the issues started. First, there is NO WAY to watch your cameras from a desktop browser, this seems extremely nuts for me, how does Google, a tech powerhouse have no option for this? For my Amazon cameras, I would just log into cloudcam.amazon.com and instantly watch all my cameras at once. When I'm at work it was an easy way to monitor all my cameras at once. But for Google Nest, nope, you have to watch from your phone. Not ideal when I'm at work and you can't watch on a big screen. I can not express the amount of disappointment this brings. Apparently before Google bought Nest you could watch them on a desktop. So disappointing.I placed my new cameras on the same spots as my old Amazon Cloudcams, they are reasonably located from my WiFi router and boosters. My 4 year old Cloudcams performed flawlessly from these locations, video streaming loaded right away. Google Nest cameras constantly refresh with a black screen and give me constant 'Live video unavailable'. So far owning them for 4ish days I get that message 90% of the time. Performance has been extremely underwhelming for a Google product. How can brand new cameras perform so poorly compared to 4 year old 'obsolete' technology.You want to watch recorded video clips? Good luck, they take FOREVER to load. By the time they load your house has already been robbed. Clips taking up to a minute to load. These are recorded clips in the cloud, how can this be so slow? Again on my Amazon Cloudcam it takes about 3-5 seconds for a 5 minute clip to load. Google Nest takes up to a minute to load a 10 second clip.When the camera works (and its not often) the video quality is great, night vision feature is sharp, motion detection is also great. Unfortunately though the Google ecosystem is extremely subpar. Their Home app is also something to be desired. It seems so rushed and poorly designed, like a last minute 'we need an app' situation. The lack of customizing where you want icons placed are also so so bad.As for customer service, I chatted them today trying to get help, I've been on the chat so far for 36 minutes getting the same copy and paste answers from their CS person. Took 20 minutes for them to get figure out how to get me to approve for them to get into my system. Going on 40 minutes they ask me for a screenshot. Big yikes Google.I want to like the cameras but ultimately I will return them all (I spent north of $500 on all of these). Maybe try the more expensive Ring or cheaper Wyzecam.If you're looking for an easy setup camera system with little frustration, these are not it.Update: over 1.5 hours with Google support and they seemed clueless. Telling me to uninstall the app, turn off the cameras, asking me what phone I was using, it was all useless. Most of them I already did. Anyway, all 4 cameras have been returned to Amazon.While I was on the chat for over 1.5 hours I researched other cameras and decided to go with Wyzecam. $99 a year for unlimited cameras, web browsing included, color night vision. Cheaper pricepoint on the hardware too. Read more

amazon.Title: Google indoor Nest Security Cam 1080p (Wired) - 2nd Generation - Snow
amazon.Description: The indoor Nest Cam security camera knows the difference between a person and a pet, and alerts you about the things that matter to you. The camera’s 24/7 live view shows you what’s happening from anywhere in the Google Home app.[1] And with up to 3 hours of free event video history, you can go back and see what you missed.[2] This home security camera lets you view live HD video, replay video recordings, talk to visitors, and more – all from the Google Home app. Nest Cam requires a free Google Account and is not compatible with the Nest app. [1]Some features, including mobile notifications, remote control, video streaming, and video recording, require working internet and Wi-Fi. [2]Up to 3 hours recording. Learn more at g.co/nest/3hours. [3]Nest Aware subscription sold separately. Continuous video recording requires that you wire Nest Cam. [4]Learn more at g.co/nest/cam-mem.

amazon.Title: N/A
amazon.Description: The Nest Cam security camera is wire-free and weather resistant, so it goes almost anywhere you need it, outside or in. Know when something important happens at home with intelligent alerts and take action right from the Google Home app.[1] Because it’s a wireless security camera, it’s easy to install yourself – no outlet required. View live HD video, replay video recordings, talk to visitors, and more – all from the Google Home app. This home security camera requires a free Google Account and is not compatible with the Nest app. [1]Some features, including mobile notifications, remote control, video streaming, and video recording, require working internet and Wi-Fi. [2]Up to 3 hours recording. Learn more at g.co/nest/3hours. [3]Nest Aware and Nest Aware Plus subscription sold separately. [4]Learn more at g.co/nest/cam-mem.

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Google Nest system is the way to go!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2024
reviews.comment: I can’t speak highly enough on these cameras. We use the whole google system on the house. Love how everything works through the app.The camera picture quality is great. Capture of people on camera works excellent. We have the battery operated ones that need charged. We have to charge them about every 3 weeks depending how much the camera is recording. Ed also use the cameras at our cabin and they stay charged for about a month or longer as there is very little activity happening. Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Continued customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2025
reviews.comment: I have been utilizing Google cameras since before google bought nest. These have the same great quality i have come to know and expect from the google nest series. Easy to install and set up, and the service fee isn't too bad when you think what commerical companies would charge. Read more

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars 9/10

reviews.comment: Image quality is excellent. Battery lasts around 6 weeks. If you live in a cold weather environment the battery will drain rapidly. I live in NC and just came through a Southern Winter and there were several times the battery drained quickly on me. Read more

reviews.comment: Great camera. Very good night vision Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviews.comment: What a great product! The sale price was an added perk! These cameras have amazing range and are so clear the recording is like being there in person! Highly recommend! Read more

reviews.title: 1.0 out of 5 stars battery life is just horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2024
reviews.comment: after years of having a great experience with the older Nest products, although their wired versions does not withstand (power cable) UV light and will ultimately fail to work, but still a great camera. I reached out to Google about this and basically told me to buy the newer wireless cams as the warranty was expired - i would have expected a bit more from google as this is clearly a design/material fault.For the newer version, the battery life is just terrible, i am have to charge these cameras every 2-3 weeks depending on activity, its just a major hassle, especially when out of town.The transition from the nest app to the home app is also troublesome, i have older and newer versions of Nest and have to manage them on 2 different apps. Not Great - Conclusion, nest started out great, i was a big fan, but now i feel they dropped the ball on multiple fronts - I spent a lot of money on Nest for home and business, and decided its time to move on to another product with better features and less hassle, and no monthly fees. Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars They work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2024
reviews.comment: I don’t know about the complaints but these work fine for me. No issues at all. Love that I can check my home when I want. Read more

reviews.title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not usable as a battery camera, need to buy extra cables!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2024
reviews.comment: I am usually a fan of Google's devices with thier easy set up and robust operating and resetting in adverse coditions. This 3-pack of battery operated cameras failed to meet that expectation. Considering the 3-pack cost almost $450, I am severely disappointed in the shortcuts taken and the false claims about battery life.What you need to be aware of is that:1) battery life of these are not enough to get you through the night (if solar powered for example)2) providing power to the camera requires a unique Google proprietary cable.How many sets of power supplies and cables come in a 3-pack? ONE! I had purchased the 3-pack of solar panels and thought that would be the solution. Nope. One camera only ran briefly on this set up, and I still haven't been able to get the 3rd camera to connect (despite router and phone in the same room, so it has to be the battery or a broken camera.) So I have to play musical chairs with the one charger and power supply to get a camera up and running. One still hasn't but I will update when I find resolution to that problem.Frankly, I wish I would have stuck with the wired 1st gen cameras (indoor or outdoor depending on the need) and that's my recommendation to you. Read more
